title: Dolan's Cadillac
plot: A young man attempts to seek to avenge his wife's death after she is murdered by a Las Vegas mobster.

title: Lady Chatterley
plot: An unhappily married aristocrat begins a torrid affair with the gamekeeper on her husband's country estate.

title: The Truth About Cats & Dogs
plot: A successful veterinarian and radio show host with low self-esteem asks her model friend to impersonate her when a handsome man wants to see her.

title: Paris Trout
plot: In a small Georgia town in the 1950s, bigoted store owner Paris Trout kills a young black girl when his brother refuses to pay his debts.

title: New Adventures of a Yankee in King Arthur's Court
plot: A singing mechanic from 1912 finds himself in Arthurian Britain.

title: Pilate and Others
plot: The trial of Yeshua Ha-Notsri is led by prosecutor Pontius Pilate who believes in the innocence of the accused but is forced to sentence him to death. This biblical story is set in present-day Germany.

title: Oscar Wilde
plot: A chronicle of Oscar Wilde's libel suit against the Marquis of Queensberry and the tragic turn his life takes because of it.

title: La Reine Margot
plot: Young Queen Margot finds herself trapped in an arranged marriage amidst a religious war between Catholics and Protestants. She hopes to escape with a new lover, but finds herself imprisoned by her powerful and ruthless family.

title: Merry Christmas, Mr. Lawrence
plot: During WWII, a British colonel tries to bridge the cultural divides between a British POW and the Japanese camp commander in order to avoid bloodshed.

title: King, Queen, Knave
plot: Adopted by his rich uncle from Germany, British teenager Frank falls in-love with his uncle's Italian wife Martha, and has conflicting feelings when she suggests he should kill his uncle in order to have her and the family fortune.

title: The Thorn
plot: In the arid 1920s Australian Outback, a Catholic priest and the beautiful niece of a vast sheep station owner stand powerless before God's will, tormented by desire. How far are they willing to go in the name of love?

title: Beneath the Planet of the Apes
plot: The sole survivor of an interplanetary rescue mission searches for the only survivor of the previous expedition. He discovers a planet ruled by apes and an underground city run by telepathic humans.

title: Libahunt
plot: A young woman living in a 19th century farming village is accused of being a werewolf.

title: Spartacus
plot: The life of Spartacus, the gladiator who led a rebellion against the Romans. From his time as an ally of the Romans, to his betrayal and becoming a gladiator, to the rebellion he leads and its ultimate outcome.

title: The Princess Bride
plot: A bedridden boy's grandfather reads him the story of a farmboy-turned-pirate who encounters numerous obstacles, enemies and allies in his quest to be reunited with his true love.

title: Babe
plot: Gentle farmer Arthur Hoggett wins a piglet Babe at a county fair. Narrowly escaping his fate as Christmas dinner, Babe bonds with motherly border collie Fly and discovers that he too can herd sheep. But will the other animals accept him?

title: Apollo 13
plot: NASA must devise a strategy to return Apollo 13 to Earth safely after the spacecraft undergoes massive internal damage putting the lives of the three astronauts on board in jeopardy.

title: Lawrence of Arabia
plot: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I in order to fight the Turks.

title: Mary Shelley's Frankenstein
plot: When the brilliant but unorthodox scientist Dr. Victor Frankenstein rejects the artificial man that he has created, the Creature escapes and later swears revenge.

title: They're a Weird Mob
plot: An Italian sports journalist arrives in Australia but finds no work. The only employment he can find is as a builder's labourer. At first, he cannot comprehend the culture, but eventually he finds mateship and romance.

title: Crow Hollow
plot: 1952. Drama. Directed by Michael McCarthy. Starring Natasha Parry & Donald Houston. In a spooky mansion, one of three sinister spinsters tries to poison her nephew's wife to steal a large inheritance.

title: Divá Bára
plot: A young, free spirited farmer's daughter is derided as a witch by the people of her village. Those that know her closely realise she is kind-hearted, if somewhat eccentric. Tensions boil over as superstition takes hold of the town.

title: The Knife That Killed Me
plot: A journey through the memories of teenager Paul Varderman as he reflects on the events leading to the fatal moment his life is cut short. Paul moves to a new school and becomes involved with 'The Freaks', a group on the periphery of school life, those who don't fit in: scene kids, emo kids, indie kids. Outsiders. At the same time he attracts the attention of the schools twisted and manipulative bully, Roth. When Paul delivers a message from Roth to the leader of a gang at a rival school, it sparks a dangerous feud. Faced with growing pressures from both groups, Paul must decide where his friendship lies, a decision that may cost him his life.—Kit Monkman and Marcus Romer

title: Butley
plot: An English professor finds his life crumbling around him.

title: Absolute Power
plot: Career thief Luther Whitney (Clint Eastwood) witnesses a horrific crime involving U.S. President Alan Richmond (Gene Hackman).

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
plot: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.

title: The Time Machine
plot: Hoping to alter the events of the past, a 19th century inventor instead travels 800,000 years into the future, where he finds humankind divided into two warring races.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
plot: Drama based on Russian writer Fyodor Dostoevsky's homonymous novel about the proud Karamazov family in 1870s Russia.

title: Den forsvundne pølsemaker
plot: The detectives Gløgg and Rask is put on the task of finding out what has happened to the lost sausage maker H. Brand. They find him after a lot of trouble.

title: They Came to a City
plot: Adapted from a J.B. Priestley play with many of the original actors. The tale of various people who have come to live in an "ideal" city and their hopes and reasons for doing so.

title: Jane Eyre
plot: A mousy governess who softens the heart of her employer soon discovers that he's hiding a terrible secret.

title: Towards Zero
plot: Superintendent Battle and Inspector Leach probe the killing of a widow in Gull's Point. A failed suicide, a false theft charge, and a tennis star's love life surprisingly connect, culminating in the revelation of a murder plot.

title: Le Château de verre
plot: Evelyne, the young wife of Judge Bertal, falls in love with Remy, who lives in Paris, during a holiday in Italy. After following him in the lovers city, she realizes Remy is the one she really loves, she decides to return home to inform her husband about all - but her plane crashes.—Cesare Emilio Castelli

title: Gumnaam
plot: Eight people are stranded on an island. They reach a mansion where a butler is awaiting them. Then an unknown, vengeful person starts killing them, one by one.

title: Gifted Hands: The Ben Carson Story
plot: Biography of Ben Carson who grew up to be Dr. Ben Carson, a world famous neurosurgeon at Johns Hopkins.

title: Quo Vadis
plot: After fierce Roman commander Marcus Vinicius becomes infatuated with beautiful Christian hostage Lygia, he begins to question the tyrannical leadership of the despotic emperor Nero.

title: Syriana
plot: A politically charged epic about the state of the oil industry in the hands of those personally involved in and affected by it.

title: Chased by the Dogs
plot: After four years in prison, the young thief Said Mahran come out of jail & seek revenge against those who betrayed him,his beloved wife and his trusted henchman, who conspired to turn him into the police,they are now married to each other and are keeping his six-year-old daughter from him and his mentor Rauf Ilwan.The original title in Arabic mean "the thief & the dogs" this movie was Adapted from a famous novella by Naguib Mahfouz how also co-wrote the film screenplay.Mahfouz was inspired by the life of the famous Egyptian thief Mahmoud Amin Soliman.—farnas

title: The Doughgirls
plot: While sharing a hotel suite during the World War II housing shortage in Washington, D.C., three friends discover that their respective marriages are not legally valid.

title: Phantom of the Opera
plot: A young soprano becomes the obsession of a disfigured and murderous musical genius who lives beneath the Paris Opéra House.

title: The Pirates! Band of Misfits
plot: Pirates, new expanded feature.

title: Beauty and the Beast
plot: A brave, beautiful, and brilliant young woman is imprisoned by a beast in his castle. Despite her fears, she learns to see beyond the beast's hideous exterior and realize the gentle heart of the true prince within him.

title: The Dancer Upstairs
plot: A police detective in a South American country is dedicated to hunting down a revolutionary guerilla leader.

title: The Clockmaker
plot: A Watchmaker finds out one day that his son has become a murderer. He tries to understand for whom and why.

title: Solo
plot: Follows the adventures of Sung Jinwoo in a world that is constantly threatened by monsters and evil forces. In his battles Sung transforms himself from the weakest hunter of all mankind to one of the strongest hunters in existence.

title: She
plot: Professional writer and amateur sleuth Jessica Fletcher uses her intellect, charm, and persistence to get to the bottom of every crime she encounters.

title: The Old Curiosity Shop
plot: A kindly shop owner whose overwhelming gambling debts allow a greedy landlord to seize his shop of dusty treasures. Evicted and with no way to pay his debts, he and his granddaughter flee.

title: El Amateur
plot: A CIA cryptographer manages to blackmail his agency into training him to let him go after a group of terrorist who killed his wife.

title: The Bridge of San Luis Rey
plot: In 1714 Peru, a friar is tried by the Inquisition for questioning God's intentions when five die in the collapse of an Andean rope bridge.

title: Swann in Love
plot: In Belle Époque Paris, a 19th century Parisian aristocrat (Jeremy Irons) falls in love with a lower-class prostitute (Ornella Muti) who seduces him but never loves him.

title: Beau Geste
plot: Three adopted English brothers join the French Foreign Legion in North Africa after one of them steals their adoptive family's famous heirloom sapphire.

title: The Russia House
plot: A British publisher is sent a manuscript detailing Soviet Union nuclear missile capabilities. British Intelligence intercept it and recruit him to investigate the author's editor, a beautiful Russian woman he claims never to have met.

title: The Red Lanterns
plot: The inextricably intertwined stories of five women who work as prostitutes just before the ban on brothels in Troumba.

title: 'night, Mother
plot: An American spy behind the lines during WWII serves as a Nazi propagandist, a role he cannot escape in his future life as he can never reveal his real role in the war.

title: Portnoy's Complaint
plot: The movie chronicles a young man's (Richard Benjamin) love and passion in his own kinky way.

title: Ivanhoe
plot: Wilfred of Ivanhoe, a worthy and noble knight, the champion of justice returns to England after the holy wars. He finds England under the reign of Prince John and his henchmen and finds himself being involved in the power-struggle for the throne of England. Will justice prevail and will all fair ladies in distress be rescued?—<dat92oma@ludat.lth.se>

title: Sounds of Sand
plot: Desert is eating the land, and water is gone. The family in Djibouti has to go even if there's the threat of war. Rahne heads east with his children and wife and their lifestock. Dangers lie ahead, around every corner. One by one is lost.

title: The Deluge
plot: During the 1655 war between Protestant Sweden and Catholic Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth some Polish-Lithuanian nobles side with Swedish king Charles X Gustav while others side with the Polish king Jan Kazimierz.

title: Rising Sun
plot: When an escort girl is found dead in the offices of a Japanese company in Los Angeles, detectives Web Smith and John Connor act as liaison between the company's executives and the investigating cop Tom Graham.

title: How to Eat Fried Worms
plot: During the first day of his new school year, a new kid in town squares off against a bully and winds up accepting a dare that could change the balance of power within his class.

title: Norwegian Wood
plot: Toru recalls his life in the 1960s, when his friend Kizuki killed himself and he grew close to Naoko, Kizuki's girlfriend, and another woman, the outgoing, lively Midori.

title: The Great White Hope
plot: A Black champion boxer and his white female companion struggle to survive while the white boxing establishment looks for ways to knock him down.

title: Dead Man Walking
plot: A nun, while comforting a convicted killer on death row, empathizes with both the killer and his victim's families.

title: The Four Feathers
plot: A young British officer resigns his commission just before his regiment is sent to battle and soon receives four white feathers from his friends and fiancee as symbols of what they view as his cowardice.

title: Noises Off...
plot: A traveling theater group find so much action going on behind the scenes that they almost ruin the performances.

title: The Luck of the Navy
plot: Secret information that might foil an enemy invasion is entrusted to a Naval commander alone.

title: The Ghost Train
plot: High jinks and chills ensue after a group of people become stranded at an isolated station and a legendary phantom train approaches.

title: Sherlock Holmes and the Voice of Terror
plot: When a German saboteur jeeringly predicts to the nation new depredations, via their radio "Voice of Terror", the Intelligence Inner Council summons Sherlock Holmes (Basil Rathbone) to help in the crisis.

title: Wilde
plot: The turmoil in poet/playwright Oscar Wilde's life after he discovers his homosexuality.
